channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 The New York Times Company

item.title: Preliminary Results Show A.N.C. With Strong Lead in South African Vote
item.description: With 63 percent of the votes counted, interim figures showed the party was in danger of winning a smaller share of the vote than it did in 2009.
item.dc:creator: By NORIMITSU ONISHI
item.media:description: An electoral worker assisted a voter at a polling station on Wednesday in Marikana, South Africa.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: ‘Pinocchio Rex,’ China’s New Dinosaur
item.description: Scientists have discovered a new species of dinosaur, a relative of the ferocious Tyrannosaurus Rex, a scientific paper says. It was found in a construction site in Ganzhou in southeastern China in 2010, stuffed into bags and assembled two years later, according to local media reports.
item.category: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
item.dc:creator: By DIDI KIRSTEN TATLOW
item.media:description: An artist's rendering of two Qianzhousaurus sinensis, showing the larger one chasing a small feathered dinosaur called Nankangia.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: China Offers Its Side of Story in Sea Dispute With Vietnam
item.description: China acknowledged on Thursday it had used a water cannon against Vietnamese vessels in a dispute in the South China Sea, but denied that Chinese Navy ships were present.
item.dc:creator: By BREE FENG

item.title: In Odessa, Home-Grown Combatants Keep Pro-Russia Forces in Check
item.description: With little help from local officials, residents who favor keeping Ukraine intact have been battling those who favor ties to Russia.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW E. KRAMER
item.media:credit: Mauricio Lima for The New York Times
item.media:description: New volunteers for a pro-Ukrainian self-defense group show up at a recruitment center in Odessa.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Eurovision’s Glorious Silliness
item.description: Sure, the song contest is corny and camp, but it brings Europe together like nothing else.
item.dc:creator: By TOM HAWKING

item.title: Egypt’s Tourism Industry Grows Desperate Amid Sustained Turmoil
item.description: The significant loss of tourism has taken a disastrous toll on the economy, starving the country of badly needed foreign currency.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: U.N. Report Documents Atrocities in South Sudan War
item.description: The report by the United Nations Mission in South Sudan said both sides in the conflict had committed crimes against humanity.
item.category: United Nations Department of Peacekeeping Operations
War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: By RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: Cities in India Among the Most Polluted, W.H.O. Says
item.description: The findings question why so much attention is focused on China when New Delhi is the most polluted city, followed by three other cities in India.
item.dc:creator: By GARDINER HARRIS
item.media:description: Pedestrians gathered as smog enveloped the Red Fort in New Delhi in 2009.

item.title: India Ink: Image of the Day: May 8
item.description: A man wearing a mask of Narendra Modi, the prime ministerial nominee of the Bharatiya Janata Party, at a protest in New Delhi.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: European Central Bank Says Stimulus Is Likely, but Not Before June
item.description: While holding its benchmark interest rate at its already record low, the bank indicated it might act next month to spur the euro zone’s economy.
item.dc:creator: By JACK EWING and JAMES KANTER

item.title: Norway’s Leaders Snub Dalai Lama in Deference to China
item.description: Tibet’s spiritual leader in exile began a visit to Oslo to commemorate the Nobel Peace Prize he was awarded 25 years ago, but the trip was overshadowed by an uproar over the government’s refusal to meet with him.
item.dc:creator: By RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: India Ink: In Assam, a Familiar Pattern of Violence
item.description: In the aftermath of attacks in western Assam on May 1 and May 2 that left at least 39 Muslims dead, both Muslims and Bodos flee their villages for relief camps.
item.dc:creator: By VIVEK SINGH

item.title: Hired by Clermont Foot, Helena Costa Sets Major Soccer Milestone
item.description: Helena Costa, the former coach of the Qatar and Iran women’s national teams, will become the first woman to coach a men’s professional team in France.
item.dc:creator: By CHRISTOPHER CLAREY
item.media:description: Helena Costa, 36, worked recently as manager of the women’s national teams of Qatar and Iran.

item.title: Ousted Thai Premier Faces Impeachment Amid Rising Tension
item.description: A day after being removed from office, Yingluck Shinawatra’s legal troubles continued as a commission recommended that she be impeached.
item.dc:creator: By THOMAS FULLER
item.media:description: Antigovernment protesters held a rally in Bangkok on Thursday to celebrate a day after a court removed Yingluck Shinawatra as prime minister.

item.title: Separatists in Ukraine Vow to Proceed With Autonomy Vote
item.description: Leaders of pro-Russian groups in eastern Ukraine said Thursday that they would proceed with the referendum, despite Russian President Vladimir V. Putin’s plea to postpone the vote.
item.dc:creator: By C. J. CHIVERS and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN
item.media:description: During a news conference on Thursday, officials representing the Donetsk People’s Republic announced plans to move forward as scheduled.

item.title: Explosion Levels Hotel Housing Government Troops in Syria
item.description: An insurgent group claimed responsibility for the attack on Thursday, saying it was a response to the mass killing of unarmed civilians in Aleppo.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By HWAIDA SAAD and ALAN COWELL
item.media:description: Forces loyal to President Bashar al-Assad searched for survivors under debris at a hotel used by Mr. Assad's forces that was blown up by rebels on Thursday in Aleppo.

item.title: Police in Deadly Confrontation in Restive Chinese Region
item.description: The police in Xinjiang, the far-western Chinese region beset by ethnic tensions, fatally shot one person and captured another on Thursday, state-run media reported on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: By CHRIS BUCKLEY

item.title: Op-Ed Columnist: China’s Monroe Doctrine
item.description: Vietnam pivots to the United States and fights a little sea battle with China as Beijing pushes to expand its sphere of influence.
item.dc:creator: By ROGER COHEN

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: The Russians Love Their Children, Too
item.description: The middle-class parents I met didn't want to discuss Ukraine; they wanted to know the optimal age to start preschool.
item.dc:creator: By PAMELA DRUCKERMAN

item.title: Op-Ed Contributors: Libya’s Unexpected Strength
item.description: Although the country faces debilitating weaknesses, a popular consensus on major issues transcends cleavages over smaller ones.
item.dc:creator: By DIRK VANDEWALLE and NICHOLAS JAHR

item.title: Blast Hits Pakistani Army Convoy, Killing 9 Soldiers
item.description: The attack in the tribal areas came as peace talks between the Pakistani government and the Taliban have been faltering.
item.dc:creator: By IHSANULLAH TIPU MEHSUD and SALMAN MASOOD

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: China Hesitates to Label Guangzhou Attack Terrorism
item.description: Instead, they have described the incident as a “knife attack,” suggesting the possibility that it was the work of a lone assailant with no connection to militants from the northwestern region of Xinjiang.
item.dc:creator: By AUSTIN RAMZY

item.title: China’s Exports and Imports Return to Slight Growth
item.description: The April figures beat market forecasts and offer some positive signals for the world’s second-largest economy after a weak start to 2014.
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: India Ink: At Election Season’s End, Sri Lankan Tamil Refugees Forgotten Again
item.description: Political leaders in Tamil Nadu usually pay little attention to the refugees’ dire living conditions, but in every election season, parties compete to portray themselves as champions of the Sri Lankan Tamils.
item.dc:creator: By VIABHAV VATS

item.title: Ukrainians Favor Unity, Not Russia, Polls Find
item.description: Two polls conducted by the Pew Research Center last month, after the annexation of Crimea, found two-thirds of Ukrainians believe that Russia is a bad influence.
item.dc:creator: By MARJORIE CONNELLY
